quizzes.title: History Quiz: Language and Languages
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, actor, country. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What language has contributed the following words to English: bungalow, jungle, thug, khaki, cot, loot, sentry, shampoo, and bangle?

The Romance languages are all descended from Latin, and form a branch of the Indo-European family. It is common knowledge that languages such as French, Spanish, Italian and Portuguese are related and are Romance languages. There is another major European language which is also a member of this branch. What is it?
Which of these languages is not an official national language in a South American country?
What European language is not related to any other language in the world?
What language has contributed the following words to the English language: ketchup, gong, orangutan, amok, bamboo, cockatoo, mango, paddy, gingham, compound (as in military compound) and cooties?
Dexter from Dexters Lab was right-handed.
The nation of Singapore has four official languages. However, all education is conducted in this language, by law.
The Chinese language is related to Japanese.

The largest language family (a group of historically related languages) is the Indo-European family, which includes well-known European languages such as English, French and Russian. Which of the following languages is NOT a member of this family?
Hades is considered one of the Twelve Olympians.
Zeus, Hades, and Poseidon are brothers.
What language has the most native speakers in the world?
Which goddess was Apollos sister?
Zeus was married to this goddess.
What movie features an actor speaking one of the Khoisan languages of southwestern Africa, which have a range of click sounds (sounds which are not found outside this region)?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Gods Must Be Crazy

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: God and Dawn
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, humanities, note. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Eros is the Greek personification of the dawn and his siblings are the sun (Helios) and the moon (Selene). Who is the Roman personification of the dawn, whose siblings are Sol (sun) and Luna (moon).
Hephaestus is the Greek God of fire and the patron of blacksmiths. Who is the Roman god of fire and craftsmanship?
Poseidon, the Greek god of the sea, was very popular and powerful among Greek sailors. His Roman equivalent was inferior in power and popularity. Who was the Roman god of the sea?
What is the name of the 3 headed dog that guards the Underworld?
What is the name of the daughter of the goddess, Demeter?
The word thimblerig means to play by the rules, to be fair.

Hermes is the Greek god of shepards, land travel, weights and measures, oratory, literature, merchants and athletics. His Roman equivalent however, is usually considered to be just the god of trade, profit and travel. Who is the Roman god in question?
Which word means a group of unofficial often secret and scheming advisers?
Dionysus is the Greek god of wine. Who is the Roman god of wine?
The city of Athens was almost named after Poseidon, rather than Athena.
The Greek goddess of flowers is Chloris. Who is the Roman goddess of flowers, the personification of spring?
Cupid is the Roman counterpart of Aphrodite, the Greek goddess of love.
Which one of these words means sooty or murky; having a dark or dusky color?
Hemidemisemiquaver is a musical time meaning 1/64 of a note.
Hades, the Greek god of the Underworld, is known as Pluto in Roman mythology.

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Word and Language
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, liechtenstein, country. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: The Mazateco language is the native language of the Mazatec peoples of Oaxaca, Mexico. Besides by words, messages in this language can be conveyed by what other means?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: By whistling

questions.question: Which is the common official language of Austria, Liechtenstein, and Switzerland?
What word means a defamatory falsehood published for political effect?
The creator of the most widely used constructed international language, Esperanto, philologist L. L. Zamenhof, had what other profession?
In which country should you be careful with any objects labelled gift (when the word is used as a noun)?
It is estimated that this country has more English speakers than the United States.
What word means melancholy, gloomy, or having a peevish temperament?
Most of the traditional Indo-European languages capitalise I, the pronoun denoting the first person singular.
Prothalamion is a funeral song.
What word means to be not reputable or decent?
Aparatchik is a blindly devoted official, follower or member of an organization.
The word henotheism means denial of the existence of gods other than ones own.
Which is the only South American country that uses English as its official language?
Which of these words begins with one and the same sound in a great percentage of the languages in the world?
Which of the following languages does not use a definite article?

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Character and Rogers
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, villain, anthropology. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Carrie Pepperidge is the comic relief in which Rogers and Hammerstein show?
Marian the Librarian is the main love interest in which show?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Music Man

questions.question: Sportin Life is the likable villain in which Gershwin show?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Porgy and Bess

questions.question: This fossil, first discovered in 1924, proved that the human race really had a natural history.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Taung Child

questions.question: Shoeless Joe Hardy sold his soul to the devil in which 50s musical revised in the 1990s?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Damn Yankees

questions.question: The name of of which extinct species means working man in Greek?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Homo ergaster

questions.question: Which Rogers and Hammerstein musical features the comic character Ado Annie?
Charlemange of the Holy Roman Empire was a character in which Fosse musical?
Often called the Father of American Anthropology, he established the first PhD program in anthropology in America.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Franz Boas

questions.question: What is the country with the greatest number of official languages?
This diminutive species was nicknamed hobbits after J.R.R Tolkiens fictional race of similar size.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Homo floresiensis

questions.question: The character of Professor Harold Hill was created by composer Meredith Willson for which musical about Mid-West small town life in the turn of the 20th century?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Music Man

questions.question: Nicely-Nicely Johnson is a second banana character in which Frank Lessor musical?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Guys and Dolls

questions.question: The beautiful Belle changes everyones fate in which Broadway musical?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Beauty and the Beast

questions.question: Which Broadway show features the character of Billy Bigelow as the male lead?

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Discovery and People
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, discovery, people. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: The word vacuum means a space entirely devoid of matter.
This anatomist is famous for his discovery of the first specimen of early hominid remains ever found outside Europe.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Eugene Dubois

questions.question: This double-letter word is used to describe many items and is even the last name of some very famous people and fictional characters.
What is the meaning of the anthropology term Pithecanthropus in Greek?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: ape man

questions.question: Sometimes people who hike  very long distances hide supplies in boxes along their route. What are these boxes called?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: bounce boxes

questions.question: The discovery site of which species was listed by UNESCO as a World Heritage Site in 1987?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Peking Man

questions.question: This is an activity you usually do on snow but sometimes it is done on water.
This double-letter word refers to a yummy baked dish that can be delivered to your house hot and ready to eat.
A bubble is a period of intense speculation in a market, causing prices to rise quickly to irrational levels and then fall even more quickly as the bubble bursts.
Turkana boy, a fossil famous for being almost a complete skeleton, was discovered in Kenya in which year?
Name the remains of a prehistoric man, whose discovery in 1996 raised sensitive political issues, related to the Native Americans rights.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Kennewick Man

questions.question: The Cro-Magnons, considered virtually identical to contemporary humans, were discovered in France in which year?
Which of the following words best fits this sentence: The next ____ will be out soon for everyone to read.?
These furry bundles of joy sometimes cause severe allergies in people.
The word savvy means intelligence or common sense.

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Word and Bear
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, birds, people. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: In computer messaging punctuation marks are sometimes used to show human emotion. What do we call a series of such marks?
This military practice was widespread among American Indian tribes well before the European colonists came to the New World. It provided warriors with proof of his courage and a war trophy.
This word refers to a newly wed man who was a bachelor for many years.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: a Benedict

questions.question: This new form of exercise which combines step aerobics with soul music.
This Navajo god of rains, whose name means water sprinkler, often played waggish tricks on mankind, but he never harmed anyone.
Because of the high cost of medical care, some older adults are abandoned by their caretakers. What is this called?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: granny dumping

questions.question: The mentoring system is all the rage. Which word refers to a person being mentored?
These items, taken from birds, were usually accepted as marks of honor or sources of ideas. They were also symbols of the Creative Force.
In 2007 this expression was introduced to describe an economy that is in a real frenzy.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: cappuccino economy

questions.question: When evoked to cure an illness, this spirit could take the form of either a woman or a man, depending on the gender of the patient.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Asgaya Gigagei

questions.question: Which of these words describes movies that contain extreme and unnecessary violence.

This is a Navaho legend, explaining the formation of a constellation. According to this myth there was a girl who married a bear. Her younger sister told their father and he got so furious, he killed the bear. In order to revenge, the bigger sister turned into a bear and began chasing her siblings. She killed her seven brothers who flew up in the sky and formed this constellation.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ursa Major

questions.question: Someone who did not like the hardware made by Apple might use this expression.
Which word refers to a very long-winded person?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A.S.S. Graduate

questions.question: Sometimes people can get so many e-mails that they cannot deal with them. They might just delete them all and start again. What is this action called?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: e-mail bankruptcy
